Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.streams.char2byte

Class AsmWriter

java.lang.Object
java.io.Writer
chav1961.purelib.streams.char2byte.AsmWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
CharStreamPrinter<AsmWriter>, java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.Appendable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class AsmWriter
extends java.io.Writer
implements CharStreamPrinter<AsmWriter>

This class is a Java byte code Assembler. It implements as an usual Writer:

try(final OutputStream os = ...;
final Writer wr = new AsmWriter(os);{
wr.write(" .package mypackage\n");
wr.write("Test .class public\n");
. . .
wr.write("Test .end\n");
wr.flush(); }

Calling flush() method is required, because it starts compilation of the class. Don't call this method before you fully types the class assembler code

After closing streams, output stream will contain ready-to-use class description, and you can pass it to ClassLoader.defineClass(String,byte[],int,int) protected method to create new class in the JVM. Syntax of the assembler instructions and pseudocommands will be described later

To increase performance, you can use cloned streams to produce multiple set of classes:

try(final OutputStream os = ...;
final Writer wr = new AsmWriter(os);{
try(final OutputStream os1 = ...;
final Writer wr1 = wr.clone(os1);{
wr1.write(" .package mypackage\n");
wr1.write("Test1 .class public\n");
. . .
wr1.write("Test1 .end\n");
wr1.flush(); } . . . try(final OutputStream os2 = ...;
final Writer wr2 = wr.clone(os2);{
wr2.write(" .package mypackage\n");
wr2.write("Test2 .class public\n");
. . .
wr2.write("Test2 .end\n");
wr2.flush(); } }

Cloned streams always inherit all the classes imported by main AsmWriter instance and all the macros loaded by it.

Current version of the class implements Java 1.7-compatible class file format with some restrictions:

  • byte code commands invokedynamic and wide are not supported in the current version (I have no any plans to support invokedynamic, but wide will be implemented soon)
  • debugging information (source file, line numbers etc) are not included in the class file

Any syntax or semantic errors in the source will produce an IOException. The Throwable.getCause() method will return an instance of SyntaxException in this case.

Don't use this class in the PrintWriter or PrintStream classes, because these classes always suppress any I/O exceptions on it's methods, so you can loose your assembler error when you use it

I not guarantee, that this implementation is free of any bugs, and nice to get any feedback about

This class is not thread-safe

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
ClassLoader, JUnit tests
LastUpdate:
0.0.4

      public AsmWriter clone​(java.io.OutputStream os) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.io.IOException

      Parameters:
      os - output stream to write content to
      Returns:
      new writer instance
      Throws:

    • importClass

      Add class to imported classes in the assembly compiler

      Parameters:
      clazz - class to add
      refName - reference name to use in '@' clause
      Throws:
      ContentException - on duplicated class or reference name
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when class to add is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when reference name is null or empty
      Since:
      0.0.4
